whyStorageModal.title: Why connect your cloud?
whyStorageModal.paragraph1: Genmypass stores your encrypted vault in your Google Drive. We do not use our own servers to store your data.
whyStorageModal.paragraph2: By encrypting everything before uploading, only you can decrypt it with your master password. Neither we nor Google can see your passwords.
whyStorageModal.paragraph3: Plus, your vault syncs across devices: phone, computer, etc. Always accessible wherever you need it.

callback.setupAccount: Connection successful! Setting up your account...

password.title: Create Master Password
password.subtitle: Set a strong password to protect your digital life. This is the only key to your vault.
password.warningDesc: Write it down and keep it in a safe place. Genmypass is zero-knowledge; if you lose this password, your data is gone forever.

learnZeroKnowledgeModal.title: What is Zero-Knowledge?
learnZeroKnowledgeModal.paragraph1: Zero-knowledge means your data is encrypted on your device before being stored. Only you have the master password to decrypt it.
learnZeroKnowledgeModal.paragraph2: We never see your passwords or your vault contents. We cannot recover them if you forget them.
learnZeroKnowledgeModal.paragraph3: It's like a safe: you hold the lock and key. We only provide the space to put it.

password.footerNote: This password encrypts your vault locally on this device.
password.footerEncrypts: Your data never leaves your device unencrypted.
password.errorSetup: Error setting up your account. Please try again.

security.selectModel: Select the encryption model that best fits your security needs.
security.passwordOnlyDesc: Secure your vault with just your master password. Standard zero-knowledge encryption that's easy to access across all your devices.
security.dualKeyDesc: Requires both your Master Password and a unique Secret Key file stored locally. Protection even if your password is compromised.

whatsDifferenceModal.title: Difference between modes
whatsDifferenceModal.passwordOnlyDesc: You only need to remember your master password. Ideal if you prioritize simplicity and quick access from any device. Perfect for most users.
whatsDifferenceModal.dualKeyDesc: Requires your password plus a secret key file you must store. Greater protection against password theft or keyloggers, but more steps to unlock and set up on new devices.

security.zeroKnowledgeDesc: We can never see your data. Your encryption keys never leave your device.

secretKey.title: Save Your Secret Key
secretKey.subtitle: This key is required to decrypt your vault on new devices. We do not store a copy of it.
secretKey.criticalDesc: Without this file + your password, your vault CANNOT be recovered. There is no 'forgot password' option.
secretKey.savedCheckbox: I have saved my secret key in a safe place, such as a physical safe or an offline storage device.

whereToStoreModal.title: Where should I store it?
whereToStoreModal.recommended1: Physical safe or fireproof box at home
whereToStoreModal.recommended2: USB drive or external disk kept in a secure location
whereToStoreModal.recommended3: Backup in another password manager or secure (encrypted) note
whereToStoreModal.avoid1: Storing it in the cloud in plain text, in email, or in unencrypted notes

whatIfLoseModal.title: What if I lose it?
whatIfLoseModal.p1: Without this key and your master password, your vault cannot be recovered. We do not store a copy.
whatIfLoseModal.p2: There is no «forgot my password» or account recovery—by design, no one can access your data without the key and password.
whatIfLoseModal.p3: That is why it is essential to save it in a safe place before continuing.

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.introText: At Genmypass, we take your privacy very seriously. This policy describes what data we process, how we protect it, and what rights you have as a user. Genmypass is a zero-knowledge password manager: your passwords and sensitive data are encrypted on your device and are never accessible to us.
privacy.controllerText: The data controller is David Navarro, developer of Genmypass. You can contact us at:
privacy.dataCollectedIntro: Genmypass is designed under the principle of data minimization. We collect the minimum information necessary for the service to function:
privacy.dataCollectedItem1Text: When you connect Google Drive or Dropbox, we receive a temporary access token to operate with your cloud storage. This token is managed through our OAuth proxy (Cloudflare Worker) and is stored exclusively in your browser.
privacy.dataCollectedItem2Text: Stored in your browser's localStorage: language, theme (light/dark), vault configuration, and password generator preferences.
privacy.dataCollectedItem3Text: Your password vault is fully encrypted on your device with AES-256-GCM before being uploaded to your personal cloud storage (Google Drive or Dropbox). We never have access to the encryption keys or the decrypted content.
privacy.dataNotCollectedIntro: Thanks to the zero-knowledge architecture of Genmypass:
privacy.dataNotCollectedItem1: We never see, store, or process your passwords.
privacy.dataNotCollectedItem2: We never access the decrypted contents of your vault.
privacy.dataNotCollectedItem3: We do not collect analytics, telemetry, or tracking data.
privacy.dataNotCollectedItem4: We do not use third-party cookies.
privacy.dataNotCollectedItem5: We do not store your master password or encryption keys.
privacy.cloudStorageText: Your encrypted vault is stored in your personal Google Drive or Dropbox account. Genmypass does not use its own servers to store user data. The file uploaded to your cloud is encrypted with AES-256-GCM and can only be decrypted with your master password (and optionally your secret key in dual-key mode).
privacy.proxyText: We use a Cloudflare Worker as a proxy to handle OAuth authentication with Google Drive and Dropbox. This proxy only relays authentication tokens and does not store, log, or process any personal or sensitive user data.
privacy.localStorageText: Genmypass uses browser local storage (localStorage) to save your preferences (language, theme, configuration) and session tokens. We do not use tracking or third-party cookies. No advertising or analytics cookies are installed.
privacy.securityIntro: Security is the fundamental pillar of Genmypass:
privacy.securityItem1: AES-256-GCM encryption to protect your vault.
privacy.securityItem2: Key derivation with Argon2id (64 MB memory, 3 iterations) to protect your master password against brute-force attacks.
privacy.securityItem3: Zero-knowledge architecture: your encryption keys never leave your device.
privacy.securityItem4: Breach checking via HIBP with k-anonymity: only a SHA-1 hash prefix is sent, never the full password.
privacy.securityItem5: Optional dual-key mode for additional security.
privacy.rightsIntro: In accordance with the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR), you have the right to:
privacy.rightsItem1: Access: know what personal data we hold about you.
privacy.rightsItem3: Erasure: request the deletion of your data.
privacy.rightsItem4: Portability: export your data in a standard format (CSV or encrypted backup).
privacy.rightsItem5: Objection: object to the processing of your data.
privacy.rightsText: Since Genmypass does not store personal data on its servers, most of these rights are exercised directly from the application (export, delete vault, disconnect cloud). For any additional inquiries, please contact us.
privacy.changesText: We may update this privacy policy from time to time. The date of the last update is indicated at the top of this document. We recommend reviewing it periodically.
privacy.contactText: If you have questions about this privacy policy or about the processing of your data, you can contact us at:
